newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Norilsk Nickel shares jump 17 pct to $8.56.
newsitem.headline: Norilsk Nickel shares jump 17 pct to $8.56.

text.p: Shares in metals producer Norilsk Nickel NKEL.RTS rose 17.3 percent on Friday to close at $8.56 from $7.30 on Thursday.
The closing price was not an official one.
Traders said shares were buoyed by what they called a positive shareholders meeting earlier on Friday, where Norilsk said it hoped not to issue new shares to restructure its government debt.
Senior company officials also said ADRs would not be issued until the firm achieved financial stabilisation.
"There is some sort of order being installed there which is what people are looking for," said ING Barings chief equities trader Peter Kizenko. "This is the first sign of a turnaround."
Norilsk is one of the world's top nickel and precious metal producers.
